noun.description: A distinctive attribute or aspect of something.
examples: safety features like dual air bags

noun.description: A newspaper or magazine article or a broadcast program devoted to the treatment of a particular topic, typically at length.
examples: a feature on Detroit's downtown fishery

verb.description: Have as a prominent attribute or aspect.
examples: the hotel features a large lounge, a sauna, and a coin-operated solarium

origin: Late Middle English (originally denoting the form or proportions of the body, or a physical feature): from Old French faiture form, from Latin factura (see facture).
